p.span: Copies a concept from one context to another.
xsCloneConcept oldconcept FROM oldcontext [IN oldContainer] [BY oldClass] [SCOPED oldScope] TO newConcept FROM newContext [IN newContainer] [BY newClass] [SCOPED newScope]
| xsCloneConcept late FROM ArrDelay IN MyArrDelay BY Monday SCOPED private TO late FROM ArrDelay IN MyArrDelay BY Tuesday SCOPED private

Clones the concept 'late' from context 'ArrDelay' in container 'MyArrDelay' by class 'Monday' within scope 'private' to a context with the same name in the same container in the same scope; but, a different class called 'Tuesday'.
oldconcept, oldContext, oldContainer, oldClass, oldScope, newConcept, newContext, newContainer, newClass, newScope
The name of the new concept.
The name of the new container the newcontext will be stored.
The name of the new context.
The name of the new class.
The scope (private, app, global) where the new container is stored.
The name of the existing Concept.
The name of the old context.
The name of the old container where the old context is stored.
The name of the old class.
The scope (private, app, global) where the existing container is stored.
The concept is cloned. See xsRenameConcept for details about renaming a concept.
